questions.question: What does the diversity of languages, religions and customs in India represent?
questions.answer: Rich cultural heritage

questions.question: What feeling has developed among communities living together in India for many years?
questions.answer: Oneness

questions.question: What is the result of the feeling of oneness in Indian society?
questions.answer: Unity

questions.answer: Respecting different ways of life

options.text: Religion is controlled by the state

questions.question: What freedom is guaranteed to every person under secularism?

options.text: Freedom to worship as per one’s faith

questions.question: On what basis is discrimination prohibited in a secular state?
questions.answer: Religion

questions.question: Who is treated equally by the State in India?
questions.answer: People of all religions

questions.question: Which opportunities are provided equally to all citizens?
questions.answer: Education, livelihood and government jobs

questions.question: Which groups receive special constitutional protection?
questions.answer: Religious and linguistic minorities

questions.question: What does secularism help maintain in Indian society?
questions.answer: Religious harmony

questions.answer: Healthy interdependence

questions.question: How can conflicts be resolved?

questions.question: What quality helps maintain peace in society?
questions.answer: Understanding attitude

questions.question: What does society provide through interaction and understanding?
questions.answer: New learning and enrichment

questions.answer: Different roles

questions.answer: Well-defined responsibilities

questions.answer: Parts we play

questions.question: Why are rules necessary in society?
questions.answer: To ensure smooth functioning

questions.question: How was society regulated in ancient times?
questions.answer: Through traditions

questions.question: What is needed along with traditions in modern times?
questions.answer: Laws

questions.question: What regulates society in modern times?
questions.answer: Laws and traditions

questions.question: Who carries out regulation of society?
questions.answer: Organizations and institutions

questions.question: Which bodies play an important role in regulation at the local level?
questions.answer: Government bodies

questions.question: Which value helps society move ahead together?
questions.answer: Cooperation

questions.question: What does inclusion in society mean?

options.text: Moving ahead taking all sections along

questions.answer: Moving ahead taking all sections along

questions.question: Which attitude reduces long-term conflicts?
questions.answer: Tolerance

questions.question: What happens when people accept new ideas?
questions.answer: Social life is enriched

questions.question: Which quality is learned through social living?
questions.answer: Peaceful coexistence

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of compromise?
questions.answer: Adjusting for others’ needs

questions.question: Why is tolerance necessary in society?
questions.answer: To resolve differences peacefully

questions.question: What connects individuals while performing social roles?
questions.answer: Social bonds

questions.question: Why are laws important in modern society?
questions.answer: To support orderly regulation

questions.question: Which factor helps maintain well-being in society?
questions.answer: Understanding and peace

questions.question: What enables smooth day-to-day life in society?
questions.answer: Mutual cooperation

questions.question: What is one outcome of living in society?
questions.answer: Development of personality

questions.question: Which value is learned through resolving conflicts?
questions.answer: Tolerance

questions.question: What regulates behaviour in society?
questions.answer: Rules, laws and traditions

questions.question: Which concept highlights living together peacefully?
questions.answer: Co-existence

questions.answer: Respect

options.text: Diversity leading to unity and strength

questions.answer: Diversity leading to unity and strength

questions.question: What is meant by diversity in Indian society?
questions.answer: Diversity in Indian society refers to the existence of different languages, religions, cultures, customs and traditions.

questions.question: Why is diversity considered a mark of India’s cultural heritage?
questions.answer: It reflects the richness of India’s traditions, languages and ways of life developed over time.

questions.question: How does living together for many years affect different communities in India?
questions.answer: Living together for many years develops a feeling of oneness among different communities.

questions.question: What feeling leads to unity in Indian society?
questions.answer: The feeling of oneness leads to unity in Indian society.

questions.question: What is meant by co-existence?
questions.answer: Co-existence means living together with different groups in society.

questions.question: How does co-existence increase understanding among people?
questions.answer: It helps people become familiar with each other’s traditions, customs and ways of life.

questions.question: Why is respect for different ways of life important in society?
questions.answer: It helps strengthen unity and peaceful living in society.

questions.question: How does social unity help society during calamities?
questions.answer: Social unity helps people face natural and social calamities together.

questions.question: Why has India accepted the principle of secularism?
questions.answer: To preserve religious and linguistic diversity in a sound and healthy manner.

questions.question: What does secularism ensure regarding religion in India?
questions.answer: It ensures freedom of worship and equal treatment of all religions.

questions.question: What does the Constitution guarantee to religious communities?
questions.answer: The Constitution guarantees freedom to worship according to one’s faith.

questions.question: What type of discrimination is prohibited under secularism?
questions.answer: Discrimination on the basis of religion is prohibited.

questions.question: How does the State treat people of different religions?
questions.answer: The State treats people of all religions equally.

questions.question: What opportunities are made available to all citizens without discrimination?
questions.answer: Opportunities for education, livelihood and government jobs are made available to all.

questions.question: Why are special provisions made for minorities?
questions.answer: To protect and preserve their linguistic and cultural identities.

questions.question: How does secularism help Indian society?
questions.answer: It helps maintain religious harmony in Indian society.

questions.question: What is cooperation?
questions.answer: Cooperation is the process of sharing and helping each other to solve problems.

questions.question: Why is cooperation necessary in society?
questions.answer: Society depends on cooperation for its existence and smooth functioning.

questions.question: What happens when cooperation is absent in society?
questions.answer: Lack of cooperation hampers progress and disturbs daily life.

questions.question: How does cooperation promote inclusion?
questions.answer: It helps move society forward by including all sections of people.

questions.question: When do disputes arise in society?
questions.answer: Disputes arise due to differences in opinions, ideas and views.

questions.question: What role do prejudices play in conflicts?
questions.answer: Prejudices and misconceptions can lead to conflicts in society.

questions.question: Why should conflicts not continue for a long time?
questions.answer: Long-lasting conflicts are harmful to society and its well-being.

questions.question: How can conflicts be resolved peacefully?
questions.answer: Conflicts can be resolved through compromise and understanding.

questions.question: What does tolerance mean in social life?
questions.answer: Tolerance means accepting differences and respecting others’ views.

questions.question: How does an understanding attitude benefit society?
questions.answer: It promotes learning, acceptance of new ideas and social harmony.

questions.question: What opportunity does society give to individuals?
questions.answer: Society provides an opportunity to perform different roles.

questions.question: What is associated with each role played in society?
questions.answer: Each role has well-defined responsibilities and duties.

questions.question: Why may social roles change over time?
questions.answer: Roles change due to changes in age, responsibilities and circumstances.

questions.question: Why are rules necessary for society?
questions.answer: Rules are necessary to ensure that society functions smoothly.

questions.question: How was society regulated in ancient times?
questions.answer: Society was regulated mainly through traditions in ancient times.

questions.question: What additional system is needed to regulate modern society?
questions.answer: Along with traditions, laws are needed to regulate modern society.

questions.question: How are laws different from traditions?
questions.answer: Laws are formal rules enforced by authorities, unlike customs and traditions.

questions.question: Who regulates society through laws and traditions?
questions.answer: Different organizations and institutions regulate society.

questions.question: What role do local government bodies play in society?
questions.answer: They help in the regulation of society at the local level.

questions.question: How does society contribute to personality development?
questions.answer: By teaching cooperation, tolerance, understanding and responsibility.

questions.question: Why is cooperation important within a family?
questions.answer: Without cooperation, a family cannot remain united.

questions.question: What is meant by inclusion in society?
questions.answer: Inclusion means taking all sections of society along while moving forward.

questions.question: How does society help in learning peaceful living?
questions.answer: Society teaches compromise, tolerance and understanding.

questions.question: What values are essential for maintaining peace in society?
questions.answer: Tolerance, cooperation and understanding are essential values.

questions.question: Why is mutual understanding important in a diverse society?
questions.answer: It helps reduce conflicts and strengthens unity.

questions.question: How does diversity enrich social life?
questions.answer: It introduces people to new ideas, customs and traditions.

questions.question: What role does compromise play in social harmony?
questions.answer: Compromise helps resolve conflicts peacefully.

questions.question: How does society encourage responsibility among individuals?
questions.answer: By assigning roles with defined duties and responsibilities.

questions.question: Why is regulation important for social order?
questions.answer: It ensures discipline and smooth functioning of society.

questions.question: How do traditions help in regulating society?
questions.answer: They guide behaviour based on accepted social practices.

questions.question: How do laws support social regulation?
questions.answer: Laws provide a formal system to maintain order and justice.

questions.question: What is the relationship between diversity and unity?
questions.answer: Diversity, when respected, strengthens unity in society.

questions.question: Why is secularism important in a diverse country like India?
questions.answer: It ensures equality and harmony among different religious groups.

questions.question: What overall lesson does this chapter convey?
questions.answer: The chapter highlights how diversity, cooperation and secularism strengthen society.

questions.question: How does long-term co-existence among different communities strengthen Indian society?
questions.answer: Long-term co-existence develops mutual understanding and a feeling of oneness, which strengthens unity in Indian society.

questions.question: Why is diversity described as a source of strength rather than weakness?
questions.answer: Diversity enriches society by bringing multiple traditions, ideas and ways of life that promote learning and unity.

questions.question: How does respect for different traditions help maintain social harmony?
questions.answer: Respect reduces conflicts and encourages peaceful co-existence among different groups.

questions.question: Why is unity essential for facing natural and social calamities?
questions.answer: Unity enables people to cooperate and support each other during difficult situations.

questions.question: How does co-existence contribute to social learning?
questions.answer: It helps people learn about others’ customs, beliefs and ways of life.

questions.question: Why is secularism necessary in a multi-religious society?
questions.answer: Secularism ensures equal treatment of all religions and prevents discrimination.

questions.question: How does freedom of worship strengthen democratic values?
questions.answer: It allows individuals to follow their faith freely, promoting equality and mutual respect.

questions.question: Why is equal access to education important in a secular society?
questions.answer: Equal access promotes social justice and balanced development of all communities.

questions.question: How do constitutional provisions protect minorities?
questions.answer: They allow minorities to preserve their language, culture and educational institutions.

questions.question: Why is religious harmony important for national unity?
questions.answer: Religious harmony prevents conflicts and strengthens social cohesion.

questions.question: How does cooperation act as the foundation of society?
questions.answer: Society survives and progresses through mutual help and shared responsibility.

questions.question: Why does lack of cooperation affect daily life?
questions.answer: Without cooperation, routine activities and social progress become difficult.

questions.question: How does cooperation encourage inclusion?
questions.answer: It ensures that all sections of society move forward together.

questions.question: Why are conflicts unavoidable in society?
questions.answer: Conflicts arise due to differences in opinions, ideas and perspectives.

questions.question: How do prejudices increase social conflicts?
questions.answer: Prejudices create misunderstandings and mistrust among people.

questions.question: Why is compromise considered essential for conflict resolution?
questions.answer: Compromise helps balance differing interests and restores harmony.

questions.question: How does tolerance improve social relationships?
questions.answer: Tolerance allows acceptance of differences and peaceful interaction.

questions.question: Why does understanding attitude enrich social life?
questions.answer: It promotes learning, acceptance of new ideas and mutual growth.

questions.question: How does society help individuals develop responsibility?
questions.answer: By assigning roles with clear duties and expectations.

questions.question: Why do social roles change over time?
questions.answer: Roles change with age, circumstances and social responsibilities.

questions.question: How does performing multiple roles shape personality?
questions.answer: It builds adaptability, cooperation and a sense of duty.

questions.question: Why are rules necessary for social discipline?
questions.answer: Rules guide behaviour and maintain order in society.

questions.question: How did traditions regulate society in ancient times?
questions.answer: Traditions guided behaviour through accepted social practices.

questions.question: Why are laws essential in modern society?
questions.answer: Laws provide a formal system to ensure justice and regulation.

questions.question: How do laws and traditions work together?
questions.answer: Together they guide behaviour and ensure smooth social functioning.

questions.question: Why is regulation important for social stability?
questions.answer: Regulation prevents disorder and maintains harmony.

questions.question: How do local government bodies support regulation of society?
questions.answer: They enforce rules and address issues at the local level.

questions.question: Why is inclusion necessary for balanced development?
questions.answer: Inclusion ensures that no group is left behind in progress.

questions.question: How does diversity promote mutual learning?
questions.answer: It exposes people to different perspectives and cultural practices.

questions.question: Why is peaceful co-existence essential in a diverse society?
questions.answer: It allows different communities to live together without conflict.

questions.question: How does secularism support unity in diversity?
questions.answer: It treats all religions equally while respecting differences.

questions.question: Why is equality important in social development?
questions.answer: Equality provides fair opportunities and strengthens social trust.

questions.question: How does cooperation help in social progress?
questions.answer: It enables collective problem-solving and shared growth.

questions.question: Why is tolerance considered a social value?
questions.answer: Tolerance helps maintain peace and mutual respect.

questions.question: How does understanding reduce long-term conflicts?
questions.answer: It promotes dialogue and peaceful resolution of differences.

questions.question: Why is regulation necessary even in cooperative societies?
questions.answer: Regulation ensures consistency and fairness in behaviour.

questions.question: How does society influence individual values?
questions.answer: It teaches cooperation, respect and responsibility.

questions.question: Why is unity important despite diversity?
questions.answer: Unity enables collective strength and social stability.

questions.question: How does social harmony contribute to national development?
questions.answer: Harmony creates a stable environment for growth and progress.

questions.question: Why is compromise preferable to prolonged conflict?
questions.answer: Compromise restores peace and prevents social disruption.

questions.question: How does society teach peaceful conflict resolution?
questions.answer: Through dialogue, tolerance and mutual understanding.

questions.question: Why are social rules important for daily life?
questions.answer: They guide behaviour and ensure smooth interactions.

questions.question: How does diversity influence social creativity?
questions.answer: Different ideas and traditions encourage innovation and learning.

questions.question: Why is inclusion a sign of a healthy society?
questions.answer: It reflects equal participation and shared responsibility.

questions.question: How does society help individuals face challenges?
questions.answer: Through cooperation, unity and collective support.

questions.question: Why is regulation linked with social order?
questions.answer: It maintains discipline and prevents chaos.

questions.question: How does diversity strengthen democratic values?
questions.answer: It encourages participation, equality and mutual respect.

questions.question: Why is social unity necessary for long-term peace?
questions.answer: Unity minimizes divisions and promotes cooperation.

questions.question: How does this chapter connect diversity with development?
questions.answer: It shows that diversity, when managed through cooperation, leads to progress.

questions.question: What overall message does this chapter convey about society?
questions.answer: A society grows stronger through diversity, cooperation, secularism and regulation.
